description_nft_drop: The activation of EIP-1559 institutes a big change. A change met with excitement by an ever-growing number of people. What better way to celebrate this milestone than with a laugh, a cheer, and a gorgeous NFT.
faq_answer_1:
Ultra sound money is an Ethereum meme focusing on the likely decrease of the ETH supply.

If capped-supply gold is sound, decreasing-supply ether is ultra sound.
faq_answer_2:
The ETH supply decreases whenever more ETH is destroyed via fee burn than ETH is created via issuance.

Fee burn is a scarcity engine fuelled by Ethereum's transactional utility.
faq_answer_3: Fee burn is a mechanism which destroys ETH base fees paid for transaction inclusion on Ethereum. Fee burn started August 5, 2021 with the activation of EIP-1559.
faq_answer_4:
Base fees are protocol-quoted minimum fees for transaction inclusion in an Ethereum block.

Priority fees paid in addition to base fees are not burned.
faq_question_5: When will ETH be ultra sound?
faq_answer_5:
The ETH supply will likely decrease when PoW issuance is removed, leaving only PoS issuance.

The removal of PoW will happen at the merge, likely Q3 2022.
faq_answer_6: The merge (see EIP-3675) is the hot-swapping of issuance-heavy PoW for issuance-light PoS. The merge will cause an issuance shock called the triple halvening.
faq_answer_7:
The triple halvening is an issuance cliff roughly equivalent to three Bitcoin halvenings.

At the merge total issuance drops from ~15K ETH/day to ~1.5K ETH/day.
faq_question_8: What are the origins of the meme?
faq_answer_8: Aug 2020â€”Vitalik Buterin jokes about supersonic money Sep 2020â€”Justin Drake memes about ultrasound money Mar 2021â€”Bankless popularizes ultra sound money
faq_question_9: What is the bat signal ðŸ¦‡ðŸ”Š?
faq_answer_9:
The bat signal is a visual expression of the ultra sound money meme, a playful nod to bat ultrasounds.

The ultra sound fam wears the bat signal to spread the meme.
